revised_title: Two Cases of Trichromic Vision: Exploring Color Perception and Deficiencies
tldr: This article presents two cases of trichromic vision, where individuals can only see three colors in the spectrum: red, green, and violet. The authors discuss the difficulties these individuals face in distinguishing colors and the effects of simultaneous contrast on their perception. The findings suggest that these cases are bordering on tetrachromic vision, where a distinct sensation is created by the sodium flame.
